author: Staff Reporter
text:
Unidentified persons gained entry into the house of a bus conductor at Samiyar Medai in Ondipudur on Wednesday and decamped with jewellery weighing seven-and-half sovereign, a laptop and mobile phone.

The Singanallur police said that the incident happened when Venkatachalam was away on duty and his wife and son were at home.

Police have registered a case in this connection.

Three held

Singanallur police have arrested Ramesh (33), Nataraj (25) and Kumar (32) on charges of stealing reams of paper from a paper manufacturing unit in the area.

Two arrested

Kuniamuthur police have arrested I. Ibrahim (53) and R. Kathirvel (41) on charges of forging documents to cheat a woman of her land measuring 1.85 acre in the area.

The police said that they were on the lookout for two more accused K.L. Rajan and Vijayakumar.

The four had forged the signature of the land owner K. Selvakumar, prepared a forged document and got it registered.

Based on the registration, the four were flattening the land with an earth mover, when the woman got wind of their plans and questioned how they could enter her land. The four abused and also threatened her, the police said.
title: Jewellery stolen
